Articles.Content:
the challenge is, make a craft that can go as high as possible and land in one piece WITHOUT using parachutes, RCS, gliding or retrorockets

Impossible you say?

on the pad

heres the target to beat, 1011m

gravity takes over

perfectly safe landing

yes, i do admit i had to do seperate flights, landing on the launch pad or the ramp WILL affect desired results

you can use any part so long as it is not modified/nerfed by yourself
Challenge Accepted.
I agree to your challenge. Although i dont think kerman does

WITHOUT using parachutes, RCS or retrorockets

Wouldn\'t this allow planes? Heck, my Skybax can reach a kerbal escape trajectory, turn around, and glide back to an unpowered landing. Does that count?

Wouldn\'t this allow planes? Heck, my Skybax can reach a kerbal escape trajectory, turn around, and glide back to an unpowered landing. Does that count?

I guess its a perfectly fine agument, my Satellite Launcher Shuttle goes to orbit, deploys the satellite and go back to earth using only one extra booster to compensate the satellite weight (without the satellite it can go to escape velocity).

Wouldn\'t this allow planes? Heck, my Skybax can reach a kerbal escape trajectory, turn around, and glide back to an unpowered landing. Does that count?

nope, vertical landing too

Wouldn\'t this allow planes? Heck, my Skybax can reach a kerbal escape trajectory, turn around, and glide back to an unpowered landing. Does that count?

We really need re-entry heat. Any plane can simply re-enter the atmosphere at around 10km/s and still come about to around 150m/s when you are at landing altitude.

We really need re-entry heat. Any plane can simply re-enter the atmosphere at around 10km/s and still come about to around 150m/s when you are at landing altitude.

oh god

your plane braking up in a ball of fire due to heat

yes

yes

yeeeeeees

You know, atmospheric drag would slow you down a lot.

But if you make an ultra-light design it could work. Is staging allowed?
anyway, has anyone suceeded yet?

Don\'t see helicoptering anywhere on the 'NO' list so...

Just lifted off.

Oops.

The mark to beat, 47536m.

Almost there!

YES!!

I\'m not sure if I understand the challenge.

Is the challenge to survive a terminal velocity fall? Are you allowed to use winglets?

What\'s the distinction between using winglets and being a plane?

Basically I think OP wants a \'manly\' rocket that..

Thrusts like a Saturn V

Goes ballistic like a Soyuz emergency re-entry.

8G re-entry ftw lol.

Anyway in game terms, vehicle must survive a free-fall landing, that\'s all.
i did it before so easy i cand o it with out mods at all ;P ill do it later and post pics of it

Basically I think OP wants a \'manly\' rocket that..

Thrusts like a Saturn V

Goes ballistic like a Soyuz emergency re-entry.

8G re-entry ftw lol.

Anyway in game terms, vehicle must survive a free-fall landing, that\'s all.

just land safely in free-fall, yes
hm, has everyone lost notice or cannot beat my record?
What are those red things you use on your craft?

What are those red things you use on your craft?

landing legs
I got up to 120m and then landed on launch pad which is at 58m with all default parts.

I got up to 120m and then landed on launch pad which is at 58m with all default parts.

without decouplers? you also need screenshots
I did decouple the lander from the rockets but I didn\'t read anything about decouplers.
